job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Privacy Engineering team is looking for a Fullstack Developer to deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks.The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle. As a member of this team, you will become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains. You will work with a global team to build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams., The privacy engineering team is looking to expand the team's skillset into full-stack development, with the goal of optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process with new tools:
     * Automation of privacy management : Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance. Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.
     * Privacy by Design : Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, . by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes. Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle.
     * Privacy Scanners: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information. Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata. Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers.
     * Privacy Architecture and Privacy-aware Product Design: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques. Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.
job_details.full_text:
Fullstack Developer

The Privacy Engineering team is looking for a Fullstack Developer to deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks.The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle. As a member of this team, you will become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains. You will work with a global team to build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams., The privacy engineering team is looking to expand the team's skillset into full-stack development, with the goal of optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process with new tools:
     * Automation of privacy management : Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance. Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.
     * Privacy by Design : Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, . by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes. Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle.
     * Privacy Scanners: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information. Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata. Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers.
     * Privacy Architecture and Privacy-aware Product Design: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques. Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on developing tools for privacy compliance automation and integration within the product development lifecycle. While it mentions automation and tooling, it does not describe core AI/ML engineering tasks like model development, training, or deployment of generative models, which are central to the ML Engineer and GenAI Engineer profiles.

phrases: deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process
addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle
become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains
inform best practices for development teams
optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process
help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance
Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process
automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes
Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle
develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information
Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers
Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques
Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office
job_tasks.justification: These phrases indicate a deep understanding of the business domain (privacy, security, compliance) and the need to align technical solutions with business goals and processes, such as 'shifting privacy left' and integrating privacy by design.
The role involves analyzing data and metadata to identify risks and produce insights, which falls under data processing and analysis, though not extensive pipeline building.

phrases: Design and develop tools and infrastructure
job_tasks.justification: The core of the role is designing and developing tools, infrastructure, and scanners, which are direct software development activities to automate processes and detect risks.

phrases: automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information
job_tasks.justification: The emphasis on automation and building tools for detection and compliance suggests operational aspects of ensuring these systems run efficiently and reliably, though not explicitly MLOps for ML models.

phrases: inform best practices for development teams
help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives
soft_skills.justification: The role requires extensive collaboration with various teams and stakeholders (global team, developers, product owners, designers, architects, Privacy Office) to integrate privacy principles and provide expertise.

phrases: become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains
expand the team's skillset into full-stack development
soft_skills.justification: The description explicitly mentions the need to become a subject matter expert and expand skillsets, indicating a requirement for continuous learning and adaptability.

phrases: optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process
Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists... achieve privacy compliance
Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing
Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles
soft_skills.justification: The role is centered around solving complex problems related to privacy compliance by designing, developing, and automating tools and processes to mitigate risks and ensure adherence to principles.

phrases: deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process
inform best practices for development teams
shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle
soft_skills.justification: Phrases like 'deliver the next generation', 'drive improvement', 'inform best practices', and 'Shape company-wide processes' suggest a proactive approach and ownership over the privacy engineering function and its evolution.
